titleStmt.title: Letter, James L. Dodds in France to Ellen Smith in Jackson, Tenn., 1918 Dec. 19

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, James L. Dodds in France to Ellen Smith in Jackson, Tenn., 1918 Dec. 19

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: Well try to write you a few lines to night to let you know I am still living and have not married any of those French girls your were talking about. I have written you regular here of late.

I have never missed as murch as six weeks yu should have gotten one letter writen about Oct 10 and in about two week I begun to write regular again. As I have told your before I was so buesy I didnt have time to write but once in a month I
I am sure you have been

recieving letters from me. regular here of late your remember I told you in my last letter I was going to move well I did. I have moved twice sence then we moved to Barsur Anhe that is about a hundred miles south west of Vraincaust on the Anhe river
We were then four days and then we moved near where we first started from at Vraincaust we are at a small town called Sowlly now about ten miles from Verdun
you remember I told you before we moved I was about fifteen miles
from Verdun I sure would make a good hand to move to move people when I get home I have had enough experance since I have been in the army, we are expecting to stay here for about two months or maybe

I dont have the least idea when we will start home I sure hope want be so ong as we thank, I am sure anxious to see you and talk to you once more as I once upon a time I thank of you often and wonder if you wont to see me

half as bad as I do you well has been raining here ever since we got here we had a little snow also to day but soon quite and began to rain a gain, The wind is blowing hard nad and has turned colder I had rather see some cold weather and not so murch rain
But of course I cant have my way as I would leave this county tomorrow
Gee" looks like Esther would be getting over all that a happy child.

well six more days and then will be x mas oh how I wish I was at home to eat that christmas dinner with you I worte you back in the summer I would be home to be with you. But I am going to run late on that date, well I don't know any thing else to write so will quiet for this time, with just lots of love
